name: Tim Buckley
description:
'''Timothy Charles Buckley III''' (February 14, 1947 â€“ June 29, 1975) was an American musician. He began his career based in [[folk rock]], but subsequently experimented with genres such as [[Psychedelic music|psychedelia]], [[jazz]], the [[avant-garde]], and [[funk]].

His commercial peak came with the 1969 album ''[[Happy Sad (album)|Happy Sad]]'', reaching No. 81 on the charts, while his experimental 1970 album ''[[Starsailor (album)|Starsailor]]'' went on to become a [[cult favorite|cult classic]]. The latter contained his best known song, "[[Song to the Siren]]." 

Buckley died at the age of 28 from a [[heroin]] and [[morphine]] overdose. He left behind one biological son, [[Jeff Buckley|Jeff]], who himself was a highly regarded singer who died young, as well as an adopted son, Taylor.
